availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Felix George Phillips (Marion County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Marion County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Frances “Fanny” Penick Phillips. Father of Mary M. Phillips, Edward W. Phillips, John H. Phillips, Nancy P. Phillips, Letita Phillips, Fannie Phillips, Agnes C. Phillips, Felix Grundy Phillips Jr., Buford N. Phillips, Charles M. Phillips, and Ceciana Phillips. Farmer in Marion County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned seven enslaved persons in Marion County in 1850. Farmer in Marion County in 1860. Owned eight enslaved persons in Marion County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, District 2, p. 399B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, p. 666.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, District 2, p. 657-658.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, District 2, p. 491A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, Lebanon, p. 49B.
Tennessee Death Records, 1908-1958, Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN, Knox County Death Certificates, File #24423.
"Felix G. Phillips, Sr. (1807-1875)," Find A Grave, Memorial #112676496 , accessed December 20, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/112676496 .
